text:
org.apache.batik.swing.JSVGScrollPane.checkAndSetViewBoxRect() throws a 
NullPointerException if the SVG document's svg element has no viewBox attribute 
(which is optional, according to the SVG 1.1 spec).  It should check the result 
from ViewBox.parseViewBoxAttribute() and return if it's null.
creator: dougo@place.org

text:
This is intentional.  Without a viewBox the scroll pane doesn't
know what part of the infinate canvas it should scroll over,
hence it doesn't know how to size the scroll thumbs or what 
effect a drag operation should have.

A possible alternative would be to look at the bbox for the
outermost SVG element but this is wrong a surprising amount of
the time (either due to intended blank space, or content that is
not intended to be viewed).

Feel free to submit patches.
creator: deweese@apache.org

text:
Ok, so an NPE isn't good, but it should throw an error.
It is intentional that the JSVGScrollPane does not work unless
the document has a viewBox.

Patches are still welcome.
creator: deweese@apache.org

text:
The scroll pane will now use the bbox of the graphics if no
viewbox is provided.
creator: deweese@apache.org
